snippet: The Kentucky county clerk symbolizes what happens when same-sex marriage and its critics can’t find a way to coexist.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Ryan T Anderson argues it was unnecessary for Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis to be jailed for refusing to issue same-sex marriage licenses; notes law  passed by North Carolina, which allows officials to recuse themselves while ensuring couples are not inconvenienced, offers example of how to achieve compromise between religious conscience and same-sex marriage.
lead_paragraph: The Kentucky county clerk symbolizes what happens when same-sex marriage and its critics can’t find a way to coexist.

headline.print_headline: We Don’t Need a Clerk in Jail
headline.main: We Don’t Need Kim Davis to Be in Jail

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
